title: AMD steals Intel’s spotlight with new Ryzen 7000 release date
description: According to a new leak, AMD may delay the launch of Ryzen 7000. The new date would ramp up the competition between AMD and Intel.

title: Intel Arc is finally here, and it’s cheaper than AMD and Nvidia
description: Intel Arc Alchemist finally makes its U.S. debut with the Arc A380, now available for sale. The pricing of the GPU seems quite competitive.

title: Airbnb to test ‘anti-party tech’ to stop disruptive events
description: As part of ongoing efforts to prevent its listings from being booked for raucous blowouts, Airbnb will pilot new “anti-party technology” in the U.S. and Canada.

title: American Airlines to buy 20 of Boom’s supersonic passenger jets
description: With an eye on slashing its flight times, American Airlines has agreed to a deal with Boom Supersonic to buy up to 60 of its in-development Overture aircraft.

title: Intel’s forgotten Arc A580 takes on the RTX 3050 — but who wins?
description: Another Intel Arc GPU has just made its appearance in a benchmark -- the Arc A580. The graphics card could rival Nvidia's entry-level models.

title: Intel Raptor Lake boosts performance, but the requirements are staggering
description: Intel Raptor Lake Core i9-13900K may come with an extra mode that boosts performance while bringing the power consumption to a staggering level.

title: The key to fixing your bad Wi-Fi connection may finally be here
description: A team of researchers from the Vienna University of Technology may have just found the solution to one of our main Wi-Fi-related woes.

title: Intel Arc A380 can be overclocked to 3.1GHz — but is it worth the effort?
description: Overclocking an Intel Arc GPU has proved to be a challenge. Although the A380 managed to hit 3.1GHz, the success was short-lived.

title: Apple finally allows you to repair your own MacBook
description: The new self-service repair will only be available to U.S. users with M1 MacBooks for the time being.

title: This half-sized micro-keyboard is a dream come true for PC gaming on the go
description: This cute and compact new keyboard could be just the thing that laptop users needed to enjoy gaming on the go a little bit more.

title: New VESA display standard makes it easier to pick a monitor
description: VESA has just created a new standard to rate the motion blur on a monitor. This should make shopping for a new display a bit easier.

title: This reliable leaker has some bad news about Apple’s M2 Pro chips
description: Reliable sources now say Apple is sticking with 5nm processes for the M2 Pro and M2 Max chips.

title: Developers help older Macs do something Apple won’t allow
description: They said your Mac was too old for macOS Ventura, but there's another way; the way of adding Ventura to your ancient Mac, thanks to the devs behind OpenCore Legacy Patcher.

title: AMD and Asus team up to make Zen 4 overclocking a breeze
description: Asus has just revealed that it will be adding a Dynamic OC Switcher feature to its ROG AM5 motherboards. This means good news for overclockers.

title: HP unveils new IPS Black monitor with one key new feature
description: HP has just unveiled several new products, but the star of the lineup is certainly the IPS Black display that takes contrasts to a new level.

title: Nvidia CEO promises RTX 30 price cuts as RTX 40 is just around the corner
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang just spoke about the company's status and plans during an earnings call. It seems that exciting RTX 4000 news are on the horizon.

title: AMD is ready to battle Intel with next-gen 3D V-Cache CPUs
description: An early leak about AMD's upcoming Zen 4 3D V-Cache processors reveals that Intel Raptor Lake might soon have reasons to worry.

title: Corsair’s Xeneon Flex is the ‘bendable’ OLED monitor we always wanted
description: Corsair unveiled the world's first bendable gaming monitor with a beautiful 45-inch OLED display.

title: Samsung reaches new heights with this SSD, but it could go even higher
description: Samsung has unveiled a powerful new SSD made with gaming and content creation in mind. Surprisingly, the manufacturer stuck to older SSD technology.

title: Chrome just added a great new way to protect your passwords
description: Chrome will soon let you fill out forms online using only your fingerprint or face unlock.

title: This game lets hackers attack your PC, and you don’t even need to play it
description: Hackers just found a clever way to abuse the anti-cheat system in a massively popular game. Without even installing the game, they can take over the target PC.

title: Apple M2 Pro and M2 Max MacBook Pro just received some good news
description: According to a new leak, Apple may release the new M2 Pro and M2 Max MacBook Pros sooner than expected. Their development is well underway.

title: We finally might know what Apple will call its AR/VR headset
description: Apple filed some trademark names for its upcoming AR/VR headset, indicating it's one step closer to launch.

title: New AMD B650 Extreme motherboards are built for budget overclocking
description: Alongside the new Zen 4 CPUs, AMD has revealed more information about the AM5 platform and the budget B650 and B650 Extreme motherboards that are coming soon.

title: This startup claims to have unlocked the secret to speedy CPUs
description: A startup has just introduced the idea that could unlock the future of chips -- replacing electrical wiring with photonics. Here's what we know about it.

title: SpaceX Starlink internet heads to first cruise ships
description: Passengers on Royal Caribbean cruise ships will soon be sailing the high seas using internet powered by SpaceX’s Starlink satellites.

title: We really didn’t expect these two new contraptions from LG
description: LG’s long list of tech goodies has just grown even longer after it unveiled a couple of contraptions for shoes and sneakers.

title: There’s a problem with those amazing Ryzen 7000 benchmarks
description: New benchmarks of the upcoming AMD Ryzen 9 7950X just emerged. The CPU absolutely destroyed its predecessor. But can you trust these results?

title: Halo Infinite Season 3 delayed until 2023, split-screen co-op canceled
description: Halo Infinite's season 3 got delayed until next year. Thankfully Forge is still on the way.

title: Apple’s antivirus strategy for Mac has gone fully preemptive, but is that enough?
description: According to Howard Oakley at Eclectic Light Company, Apple has updated macOS malware more in the past six months than in the past seven years.
